definition: victory or defeat/the outcome of a battle

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)
unable to determine victory or defeat (idiom); evenly matched/to come out even/to tie/to draw

sentences.english: It was tight. so ti lasted a long time .
sentences.chinese: 两队不分胜负，所以持续了很长一段时间。

sentences.english: Mourinho's win-lose ratio is vastly superior to that of Benitez.
sentences.chinese: 穆里尼奥的胜负场次比率要远远高于贝尼特斯。

sentences.english: The two teams tied(with each other).
As the go players have entered the deciding stage, the results should come out soon.
sentences.chinese: 围棋大师赛进入了封盘的关键阶段，胜负即将决出。

sentences.english: The two armies converge on the enemy capital for the last battle of the war.
sentences.chinese: 两军聚集在敌方首都，准备一决胜负。

sentences.english: It's the day of reckoning, will one of them be a winner?
sentences.chinese: 今天就要决出胜负，他们中会有一人胜出吗？

sentences.english: Then the final showdown with the bad kung fu kids.
sentences.chinese: 然后结局定会和反派功夫小子一决胜负。

sentences.english: The odds evened before the race.
sentences.chinese: 赛跑前，胜负的可能性变得接近了。

sentences.english: The most likely result is a draw.
sentences.chinese: 最可能的结果是不分胜负。

sentences.english: Russia is mobilizing its troops for another showdown with Georgia.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯正在调兵遣将，要与格鲁吉亚再决胜负。

sentences.english: Let's bet on the final result of the match.
sentences.chinese: 咱们就以这场球赛的胜负来赌东道。

sentences.english: Based on that, you'd think it'd be a dead-heat coming into this season.
sentences.chinese: 根据这个比较，你会认为他们不分胜负进入新赛季。

sentences.english: The score was 0∶0,so they are going to play off.
sentences.chinese: 比赛打成零比零，所以他们将加赛定胜负。

sentences.english: The war went on for four bitter years, with ups and downs on both sides.
sentences.chinese: 战争进行了四个艰苦的年头，双方互有胜负。

definition: to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
to whom the deer falls (idiom); the one to emerge victor (i.e. to seize the empire)/prize winner/champion
the result becomes apparent/(after) the dust has settled
to score a victory/to prevail over one's opponents
decisive battle/to fight a decisive battle/to fight for supremacy in ...
